intro: Galium pisiferum, commonly known as the creeping bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender, prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds. Galium pisiferum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
